trial_identification.studytitle: Does sexual inequality start in utero with sex differences in the placental transcriptome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Transcriptome-wide gene expression analysis of placentas collected at birth from male and female fetuses to evaluate the sex specific differences in human placental development.

conditions.healthcondition: Gene expression in placentas collected from healthy fetuses

interventions.interventions: We will be extracting RNA from placenta samples to observe gene expression using RNA-seq and microarray platforms. This is a single time-point "snapshot" observation to generate a gene expression profile.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Identification and expression level of all genes in male and female placentas. We will sequence RNA molecules using the Illumina Hi-Seq and Microarray platforms to generate the data and test the differences between the sexes using established and custom designed bioinformatics pipleines.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Caucasian women pregnant with a singleton or twins who will deliver by elective cesarean. Non-smokers BMI 20-40 Fathers of the pregnancy (where possible) will asked to supply a saliva sample for genome-wide SNP genotyping.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Paediatrics & Reproductive Health Level 3 Medical School South Building Frome Road The University of Adelaide SA 5005 AUSTRALIA South Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We will collect placenta samples from male and female fetuses delivered by cesarean section. RNA will be extracted from these samples and will be used for whole transcriptome gene expression profiling. This will provide insight into the sex-specific differences in human placental development.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Basil Hetzel Institute The Queen Elizabeth Hospital 28 Woodville Road Woodville South SA 5011
